Description: Lip and wall sherd, with handle scar, of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery krater; cream slip; interior glazed with two red bands lined in white; exterior: top of panel beside handle with part of a boar(?); on outer face of lip: row of blobs; on top of lip: metopal frieze of dotted rosettes alternating with florals, the preserved one a lotus flower and tendrils with flanking filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.541)
